article_title: WSJ Survey: Economists Now See Fed on Hold Until June, or Later
article_text:
The Federal Reserve probably won’t raise short-term interest rates at its policy meetings in March or April, but a move in June is more likely, according to economic forecasters surveyed by The Wall Street Journal.

In a striking shift, just 9% of the business and academic economists polled by the Journal in recent days said the Fed would raise its benchmark federal-funds rate at its March 15-16 meeting, down from 66% who last...

twitter.description: The Federal Reserve probably won’t raise short-term interest rates at its policy meetings in March or April, but a move in June is more likely, according to economic forecasters surveyed by The Wall Street Journal. In a striking shift, just 9% of the economists polled by the Journal in recent days said the Fed would raise the federal-funds rate at its March meeting, down from 66% who last month were predicting an increase then. Roughly 60% of economists in the latest survey predicted the Fed’s next rate increase would come at its June meeting, up from 25% in the January survey.
twitter.creator: @BenLeubsdorf

image.alt: WSJ survey: Economists now see Fed on hold until June, or later
